info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:25PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Big Horn and south central Yellowstone Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 323 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pryor, or 25 miles south of Billings, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail, along with brief heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pryor, Fort Smith, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
